label: ANABAT
definition: A set of methods using ANABAT echolocation recording devices for measuring the presence of bat species within a given area. The specifics of recording medium, type of detector, frequency range, configuration, placement, orientation, azmuth/depth, deployment period, etc. are detailed in specific and general methods under this category.

label: Passive acoustic monitoring
definition: A set of methods using locationally fixed acoustic recording devices for measuring the presence of vocal species within a given area. The specifics of recording medium, type of detector, amplification and gain measures, frequency range, configuration, placement, orientation, directionality, deployment period, etc. are detailed in specific and general methods under this category.

label: Active acoustic recorder named thing
definition: A set of methods using portable acoustic recording devices for measuring the presence of vocal species within a given area. The specifics of recording medium, type of detector, amplification and gain measures, frequency range, configuration, placement, orientation, directionality, deployment period, etc. are detailed in specific and general methods under this category.

label: Camera trap
definition: A set of methods for recording mobile organisms or other entities involving locationally fixed passive recording sensors spanning the infra-red, visible and ultra-violet spectral range. These methods enable temporal and geotagging of mobile targets such that they can be identified as a presence observation in space and time. Specific varibales such as camera type, trigger mechanism, baits used, spectral range, mounting arrangement, etc. are detailed under specific and general methods under this category.
Citation: Forrester, Tavis & O'Brien, Timothy & Fegraus, Eric & Jansen, Patrick & Palmer, Jonathan & Kays, Roland & Ahumada, Jorge & Stern, Beth & McShea, William. (2016). An Open Standard for Camera Trap Data. Biodiversity Data Journal. 4. e10197. 10.3897/BDJ.4.e10197.

label: mobile sensor named thing
samplingTarget: Ceataceans, megafauna, turtles, reptiles, fish, some insects
definition: A set of methods for animal tracking involving transmitting sensors mounted on mobile organisms or other entities, which enable temporal and geotagging of mobile hosts such that their movements can be tracked in space and time. Receiving sensors may be locationally fixed or portable.

label: Harp trapping
definition: A non-destructive trapping technique for intercepting in-flight micro-bats to survey for bat species presence. The specifics of configuration, trap size, placement, deployment period, etc. are detailed in specific and general methods under this category.

label: Distance sampling
methodObjective: Species presence, species abundance, species density, species behaviour
definition: A set of methods for estimating the density and/or abundance of animal populations. Collected data represents the distances of the objects being surveyed from randomly set transects or points to estimate the average density of objects within a region. The specifics of transect/point configuration and frequency, survey duration, etc. are detailed in specific and general methods under this category.

label: Aerial distance sampler method
definition: A variant of the standard distance sample method in which observations are conducted from an airborne platform rather than a terrestrial based platform.

label: Mist netting
definition: A non-destructive trapping technique for intercepting in-flight avifauna to survey for bird species presence. The specifics of configuration, trap size, placement, deployment period, etc. are detailed in specific and general methods under this category.

label: Track plot method
samplingTarget: Reptiles, large and small mammals, birds, some insects
definition: A set of methods for sampling animal presence and abundance via observations of evidence of presence. The specifics of configuration, area covered, duration of sampling effort, etc. are detailed in specific and general methods under this category.

label: Point/stand count
definition: A method for passively monitoring birds and other vertebrate fauna visiting a localised area around a locationally fixed visual observation station (eg. a hide). Observers wait quitely at a stationary location for a set period of time, identifying and counting species of interest observed entering their observation zone. The specifics of duration and timing of observing events, number of observers, size of observation zone, etc. may vary and be specified in specific surveys.
